channel.title: Andrei Pfeiffer, personal blog
channel.description: This blog if focused on technical content, related to Front-End technologies and UI development.

item.title: The anatomy of React component files
item.description: This article describes in detail my personal and current approach to defining React component files and the rationale for each decision. It covers function components syntax with TypeScript.
item.author: andrei@upsidedown.ro (Andrei Pfeiffer)

item.title: CSS-in-JS styles output methods
item.description: There are two mutually exclusive methods that CSS-in-JS libraries use to generate and ship styles to the browser: Runtime Stylesheets and Static CSS Extraction. Both methods have benefits and downsides, so letâ€™s analyze them in detail.
item.author: andrei@upsidedown.ro (Andrei Pfeiffer)

item.title: Developing UIs connected to web APIs
item.description: As UI developers, we have multiple methods we could use to connect to web APIs during development. We'll explore 3 different approaches, analyzing their strong points and limitations.
item.author: andrei@upsidedown.ro (Andrei Pfeiffer)

item.title: Validating our understanding
item.description: There is no absolute measurement tool to determine our level of understanding of a particular concept. But there are specific heuristics that we can use to evaluate ourselves.
item.author: andrei@upsidedown.ro (Andrei Pfeiffer)

item.title: Complementary learning
item.description: We took some courses, attended a few workshops, read a ton of articles, and probably one or two books too. We have even worked on a couple of personal projects. Ok, what's next?
item.author: andrei@upsidedown.ro (Andrei Pfeiffer)

item.title: Distinguishing between pages and components in Next.js
item.description: In Next.js we can customize what file extensions should be rendered as pages. This enables us to create components inside the pages folder without generating unneeded routes.
item.author: andrei@upsidedown.ro (Andrei Pfeiffer)

item.title: Empty objects initialization with TypeScript
item.description: We'll examine multiple methods to initialize empty objects in TypeScript, which is something you'll probably have to deal with in any application that has some form of state management.
item.author: andrei@upsidedown.ro (Andrei Pfeiffer)

item.title: Tech Debt or Tech Loan?
item.description: Technical Debt is a trade-off, a choice we make as developers. Sometimes we are (or feel) compelled to make these trade-offs. Sometimes it's our own decision. The fact is we can't always avoid them, so we need to learn how to manage them.
item.author: andrei@upsidedown.ro (Andrei Pfeiffer)

item.title: Definition lists with grid layout
item.description: In this post, we'll examine various implementations for a given layout, using both flex and grid, debating the robustness of each approach. The layout contains a horizontal list of 3 key-value pairs, the values being displayed beneath the labels.
item.author: andrei@upsidedown.ro (Andrei Pfeiffer)
